abstract: Place de la Republique in Paris has become site of political movement calling itself Nuit Debout, or Night, Standing Up, drawing young people who are eager to vent wide-ranging frustrations nightly for month; movement stems from anger over labor code overhaul that made it easier for employers to both hire and fire workers; movement has drawn news coverage, police crackdown and wariness of part of leaders.
lead_paragraph: Nuit Debout, a movement ignited over a plan to change French labor laws, has expanded to include a mélange of grievances, and politicians are warily watching.

headline.main: A New Generation’s Anger Resounds From a Packed Plaza in Paris
headline.print_headline: A Generation’s Unfocused Frustration Resounds From a Packed Plaza in Paris

snippet: Nuit Debout, a movement ignited over a plan to change French labor laws, has expanded to include a mélange of grievances, and politicians are warily watching.
